headline: Full debate: GOP candidates face off in Ohio U.S. Senate Primary debate
author: WLWT Digital Staff
sentences: “This May 3, Hamilton County voters will be nominating candidates for statewide offices, U.S. Congress, County Commissioners, County Auditor, Clerk of Courts, and several judicial offices, as well as deciding ballot issues in several jurisdictions,” Sherry Poland, Director of the Hamilton County Board of Elections, said in a statement.

There are three ways to cast your ballot in the May 3 Primary:
Vote by Mail
Early In-Person at the Board of Elections 4700 Smith Road
In-Person voting on election day at your polling location
Voters may submit an application for a vote by mail ballot now.
This means that during the May 3 primary, contests to nominate candidates for State Representative, State Senate, and State Central Committee will not appear on the ballot.
While the candidates share similar viewpoints on topics like the second amendment, they differed from how they would address issues like gun violence.
The GOP candidates shared their stances on topics including inflation, the war in Ukraine, gun violence and critical race theory.
